definition: A conjunction (समुच्चयबन्धनसूचक) in Sanskrit is a word that connects words, phrases, or clauses to show relationships between them.

categories.description: Conjunctions in Sanskrit are used to join words, phrases, or clauses. They can be coordinating, subordinating, or correlative.

types.description: These conjunctions join words, phrases, or clauses of equal rank.
These conjunctions connect a dependent clause with an independent clause.
These conjunctions are used in pairs to connect balanced clauses or elements.
examples: न केवलं... अपि तु (na kevalaṃ... api tu) – 'not only... but also'

categories.description: These are frequently used conjunctions in Sanskrit that help connect different parts of a sentence.

examples.example: रामः च सीता च गच्छतः (Rāmaḥ ca Sītā ca gacchataḥ) – 'Rama and Sita are going.'
रामः पठति, किंतु सीता न पठति (Rāmaḥ paṭhati, kintu Sītā na paṭhati) – 'Rama reads, but Sita does not.'
तू या अहम् वा गच्छामः (Tū yā aham vā gacchāmaḥ) – 'You or I will go.'
तू अथवा अहम् गच्छामः (Tū athavā aham gacchāmaḥ) – 'You or I will go.'
यदि तू गच्छसि, अहम् आगच्छामि (Yadi tū gacchasi, aham āgacchāmi) – 'If you go, I will come.'

categories.description: These conjunctions connect a dependent clause with an independent clause.

examples.example: यदि तुम् पठनं करोति, यदि हि किञ्चित् कर्तव्यम् अस्ति (Yadi tum paṭhanaṃ karoti, yadi hi kiñcit kartavyam asti) – 'If you study, then there is something to do.'
यदा पुस्तकं पठामि, तदा शान्तिम् अनुभवामि (Yadā pustakaṃ paṭhāmi, tadā śāntim anubhavāmi) – 'When I read a book, I experience peace.'
तू छात्रः अस्ति, किंतु पतिं न पश्यसि (Tū chātraḥ asti, kintu patiṃ na paśyasi) – 'You are a student, but you do not see your husband.'

categories.description: These conjunctions are used in pairs to create a relationship between two clauses or phrases.

examples.conjunction: न केवलं... अपि तु (na kevalaṃ... api tu)
examples.example: न केवलं रामः पठति, अपि तु सीता अपि पठति (Na kevalaṃ Rāmaḥ paṭhati, api tu Sītā api paṭhati) – 'Not only Rama reads, but also Sita reads.'
रामः एवं च सीता च गच्छतः (Rāmaḥ evaṃ ca Sītā ca gacchataḥ) – 'Rama and also Sita are going.'
